intro: Eriogonum torreyanum, commonly known as the Torrey's buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as slopes and canyons. It has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. Eriogonum torreyanum plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
